review_title: Watching This Film Sent Me Down Memory Lane To Raj Kapoor's Henna(1991)
review_detailed_main:
In 1991 a Raj Kapoor directed film Henna broke the barrier between India and Pakistan. The film shows the determination of a Pakistani woman Henna(Zeba Bakhtiar) to reunite an Indian, Chander Prakash(Rishi Kapoor) with his family back in India.

In this film we see the reverse, a Hindu man Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi(Salman Khan) is helping a mute young Pakistani girl Shahida(Harshaali Malhotra) who has been separated from her mother accidentally and finds herself on the wrong side of the Pakistani border.

A chance encounter brings Pawan and Shahida together. From then onwards Pawan's life takes on a whole knew meaning, as he overcomes all odds to reunite Shahida with her mother.

The direction, acting and photography is superb. The background music and songs are enhance the film. Salman Khan gives a sincere performance as the title character of the film Bajrangi(meaning a devotee of Hanuman). Hanuman is a Hindu god and an ardent devotee of Rama. He is a central character in the Hindu epic Ramayana.

Newcomer Harshaali Malhotra is adorable in her role as Munni. Actress Kareena Kapoor has a small supporting role in this film, but her acting as always is thoroughly professional. Sharat Saxena, who is now 65 years old, is holding up well for his age. Not to forget to mention the veteran actor Om Puri who is also 65 years old. Nawazuddin Siddiqui is superb as always. No matter whatever his role, Nawazuddin delivers an excellent performance. He is such a dynamic actor.

Verdict: a superb film which the whole family can enjoy together.

Salman Khan Selection: Maine Pyar Kiya(1989, film counted among the top 10 successful films of India), Love(1991), Saajan(highest grossing Bollywood film of 1991), Suryavanshi(1992 perhaps the only horror film he starred in), Veergati (1995 my favorite film), Majhdhaar(1996 a very underrated film), Khamoshi: The Musical(1996. Sanjay Leela Bhansali's directorial debut. The film won several awards and grossed ₹77.5 million ), Bandhan(1998 unmissable), Biwi No. 1(1999), Tere Naam(the third highest grossing movie of 2003), Baghban(2003 special appearance), Garv: Pride and Honour(2004), Phir Milenge(2004 a Controversial film dealing with the topic of AIDS), Dil Ne Jise Apna Kaha(2004), Kyon Ki...(2005 adaptation of One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest), Yuvvraaj(2008).

All the above films are a good start for your DVD collection. Thank you for having the time to read my review. May you live long and prosper.

review_title: The story of how a virtuous Indian man helps a mute Pakistani girl return home after a series of catastrophes occur in her life.
review_detailed_main: The movie 'Bajrangi Bhaijan' is a classic, if you're a Bhai fan and is something for the fans to gloat about. Personally, I think the movie has a basic storyline which intrigued me as most of the Salman Khan movies are deficient of a good plot. I would suggest you to watch it once mainly because of some really good acting skills displayed by the great Nawazuddin Siddique and the cute little debutant, Harshaali Malhotra. The angel won many hearts without even saying a word till the end of the movie. The movie starts off with with a little drama which is overshadowed by the cuteness and innocence of Harshaali. Salman's entry is pretty ordinary as he plunges into the movie with the popular song 'Selfie le le re'. Salman's character Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi aka Bajrangi is a big devotee of Lord Hanuman and is shown as an extremely virtuous and naive guy who never speaks a lie throughout the movie. I think the movie never takes off in the first half and just sets the base for the second half which attracts the attention of the viewer. If you ask me, I was disappointed with the first half but the second half makes up for it later. Kareena's role in the movie is quite minute and the movie would be the same without her. I personally believe the Bollywood diva was just casted in the movie to increase its popularity. Unlike Kareena, the movie would never be the same without The Gangs of Wasseypur Star, Nawazuddin Siddinqui. He single-handedly takes the movie to another level with his entrance at the beginning of the second half. He energizes the whole movie with his awesome acting and his perfect comic timing. Nawaz is an expert in swaying away the minds of the viewers. I appreciate Salman as he controlled his urge to involve useless and theatrical action in the movie. The end was a bit melodramatic and histrionic but after all, a Bollywood movie is never complete without histrionics. ;) The movie ends well with glee and contentment spread in all quarters. I would rate the movie 3/5 and as I recommended earlier, it is a one time watch specially because of the endearing cherub, Harshaali Mehrotra. :)

review_title: A melodramatic effort by touching the cross border propaganda
review_detailed_main:
"Bajrangi Bhaijan" is a decent effort by Kabir Khan after pretentious "Ek Tha Tiger". However, it again has cross-border propaganda like his other movies. He has this keen eye for showing India & Pakistan liaison, which has been a fiery dispute since 1947, leaving many people dead probably every hour. People are susceptible and ferocious about this.

Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi (Salman Khan) is a benevolent man with adoration for god Bajrangbali, meets Munni (Harshali Malhotra) who is lost in India when returning to Pakistan by Samjhauta Express. Now, Pawan has to take her home against all odds. The problem is that Munni is mute.

The story is meek and totally depends upon suspension of disbelief. It has all the clichéd and used ingredients like to be part of crores club. On the other hand, it portrays the humane side of Pakistan, how people are helping a person who has crossed lengths and is hell-bent to take a mute girl to his parents. It touches your emotional chords at the perfect time.

"Bajrangi Bhaijaan" also refrains from touching any sensitive issues which can disrupt the communal harmony.

Harshaali looks charming with speaking a single word and blooms with the subtle smile on her face. She and Salman have an impeccable chemistry.

It also has Kareena Kapoor Khan (Rasika) who fills the gap of being love-interest of Pawan and gives usual expressions as we see in every other movie.

The real scene stealer is Nawazuddin Siddiqui (Chand Nawab) a freelance reporter; he tickles your funny bones with perfect timing. Every time he appears on the screen, it looks that we are watching a different movie.

The cinematography is vivid as it pacifies your eyes when we see the landscape of Kashmir in aerial and long shots. The background score also flows with the story but in many scenes, it goes pretty loud with some gratuitous slow-motion scenes. Songs do not add anything but are a hindrance to the story.

However, unlike Salman's every movie, this does not go over the top because Salman does not punch goons and lets them fly in the sky, does not leave a bicycle a centimeter away from the running train or drive a London number plate bus in Poland. This time he is no "Devil" and he transpires into heart and mind at the same time. He plays this part with ease and charm.

A perfect treat for Salman's fans which gets melodramatic at the right time.

review_title: A heart-touching movie that conveys a great message
An Improvement over Salman's previous movies!!
review_detailed_main:
Bajrangi Bhaijaan is a movie that is released for the masses. It is not meant to be an art film but an unabashed commercial movie with a singular motive to earn money. However, considering the mediocre quality of high-budget movies that have been released in recent years, this movie is a step in the right direction.

The story revolves around Bajrangi played by Salman Khan who is a strict devotee of Bajrangbali and is unwilling to lie, cheat, or commit any sort of deceit. Even though some of his actions might seem silly or naive, Salman Khan pulls it off. The innocence of this character is charming.

Shahida gets lost in India while returning to Pakistan. As she is just 6 and has an inability to speak, it is extremely unlikely for her to return to her home. However, on seeing the plight of this poor girl, the magnanimous Bajrangi takes it upon himself to return her safely.

The supporting cast includes Kareena Kapoor and Nawazuddin Siddiqui. The latter plays a Pakistani Journalist who joins the quest to look for Shahida's home. It is yet another winning performance from this talented actor who manages to make every role seem effortless.

There are a number of flaws in the movie. On a lot of occasions, creative liberties have been taken. Salman Khan manages to cross the border without a passport which is impossible. At one point in the movie, he even beats up multiple police officers who were starting to get rough towards Shahida.

At the end of the day, if you are looking for a sentimental movie that touches the heart, then this is the right movie for you. It is far from perfect, but the filmmakers should be credited to make an effort in improving the current state of Hindi Cinema. Also, the innocent, wide-eyed performance by Harshali, who has no spoken lines in the movie is also good.

review_title: Nope!nope!nope!! IMDb PLEASE make a 0 rating for movie.

review_detailed_main:
What a masterpiece! It mesmerized me in the opening scene: shot of gorgeous Himalayas. And I'm still in trance. An excellent portrayal of co-existence of various beliefs and cultures in sub continent. Hero is a very simple, not-so-smart religious Hindu man in Delhi, who stumbled upon a lost 6yo Pakistani girl who is also mute, and out of sheer humanity took it upon himself to find her parents. Without any clue. In sub-continent that's his only option. No agency / institution can do anything because of the animosity between the two countries. If he dumps her, and he tried, she will fall into the wrong hands faster than he could cross the street. Now he has to somehow find her city, and then her parents, in an enemy country.

This movie shows the triumph of humanity. There is far more love than hatred between the people of the two countries. Movie highlights things like differences over food (hindus are vegetarians and Pakistanis are meat lovers, mostly), praying (how uncomfortable and guilty one gets stepping in other religion's temple, even if it's to seek a temporary refuge) and ever present political unrest. It also shows the sub continent cultural gems. Sleeping under the sky burning mosquito repellent, old school wrestling in dirt rings, larger than life India-Pakistan cricket rivalry, cruel yet incompetent police on both sides, greedy media, religious festivals in streets, shrines, belief in prayers, sporting mustaches etc.

Casting couldn't be better. 6yo girl looks like younger sister of Malala. Too cute. Salman khan as Bajrangi Bhaijan is too awesome to describe. Karina Kapur is brilliant as a next door Indian girl representing the non racist and educated younger generation. Generation that stands up for their and other's rights. Jokes are hilarious. Sound track is awesome.

Human loves kindness, unity and happiness in all. This is all that I can say this movie of Kabir Khan represents.

For the enjoyment they added a lot of things.

Two countries hate can't let a child away from his parents. That's why it is loved by all with very much love.

The movie didn't have very big story or technical things but a lot of mysterious parts become open to all.

Movie touches heart and strikes on mind. Jai Hind

review_title: Super Duper hit of the year

review_detailed_main:
So here are some of the things I expect to see in a Salman Khan film — the superstar playing a charming, irreverent superhero; a largely incoherent script that exists only to showcase him as a superhero; a largely irrelevant heroine who needs rescuing from some foolish villains; low-IQ comedy punctuated by a few crackling one-liners.

Here's what I don't expect to find — a coherent, emotionally satisfying script; Salman underplaying his super sized image; a heroine with spunk; drama that actually moves you; and tears! Yes, it happened. I have now cried while watching a Salman Khan film. Bajrangi Bhaijaan is simplistic, occasionally silly, and tiringly over-stretched. It's also unashamedly manipulative. But it works. Director and co-writer Kabir Khan preserves the larger-than-life Salman image but also allows it to evolve so that the star is not just a slick superman. Instead, he's a simpleton who teaches us that humanity stands above religion, borders and politics. Think of him as another PK, one that is human instead of alien.

Bajrangi's real name is Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi. He is called Bajrangi because he's an ardent Hanuman bhakt. This is a man so child-like and morally upright that he says Jai Shree Ram to a prostitute and insists on entering Pakistan without a passport or visa but with the permission of the security officer who apprehends him at the border. Why is he so keen to go across? Because a lost, speech-impaired six-year-old girl from Pakistan needs to be reunited with her mother. When all other methods fail, Bajrangi decides he will do it himself.

If you're reminded of Randhir Kapoor's 1991 film, Henna, yes the story is similar. But by making the displaced character a child, Kabir and his co-writer, V Vijayendra Prasad, have made the plot more potent.

In fact the biggest weapon in Kabir's artillery is the angelic Harshali Malhotra. She's refreshingly unaffected. She seems unfaded by Salman. Harshali has a heart-breaking innocence. For the viewer, it's love at first sight. You invest in her instantly and her tears wring your heart. Salman gets the requisite thundering action sequence. And yes, he does a shirtless scene. But it doesn't showcase his towering masculinity. Actually, he's being beaten up. Bajrangi is interesting because he's not invincible. Of course you know that he will eventually make miracles happen, but he also bleeds and breaks.

Salman plays Bajrangi with aplomb. He's endearingly naïve and sweetly vulnerable. Nawazuddin Siddiqui, playing a small-time television reporter, comes into the film late but is worth the wait. Unlike the character he played in Kick, he gets no flashy moments here. But he has a few terrific lines and he flies with them.

Kareena Kapoor Khan has the most under-written part, but even she gets one good scene. And as usual, her clothes make an impression; her dupattas are just gorgeous. Om Puri playing a maulana in Pakistan is also memorable.

Where Bajrangi Bhaijaan trips is on length. The film is too long and the numerous songs don't do much for the narrative. The plot feels convenient and convoluted at the same time. There are scenes that make you groan. There is also an unapologetic lack of subtlety — Kabir goes full-throttle for your heartstrings, and once he's grabbed them, doesn't let go.

This is an overblown, old-fashioned, feel good film. But I recommend that you surrender, and keep a hunky handy.

review_title: Salman Khan's best performance and film to date!
review_detailed_main:
Salman Khan is known for starring in over the top total masala action movies. He is known as the big tough hunk who just beats up people and takes off his shirt a lot to try and show off his muscle.

Well, in this film, Salman Khan broke out of that. This film is not a mindless masala movie, this film was a movie in which the makers used their minds. This film was an exceptional work.

First off, this film is one of the few films about Indian-Pakistani conflicts in which their is no bias towards a particular country, Second, both of the countries are shown as good and bad in ways. So, the film handled that subject from a good point of view.

Second, the performances. Salman Khan, man, really showed me he can act if he wants. His performance as Bajrangi was natural, heartfelt, and simply great. You can tell he really enjoyed doing his role and gave his all into it. This I would consider to be his best performance right next to Radhe in Tere Naam.

Kareena Kapoor was pretty good, even though she had a smaller role.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui was hilarious, but at the same time, natural. He played the supporting role to Salman Khan really well. He did great and I think he has great future ahead of him since his last couple of films have had him giving very good performances.

And who can forget the small girl (I don't know her name though). She stole the hearts of the audience and was adorable. She also acted pretty well and I think she handled herself very well.

The direction and story were also very good, and the songs and music throughout the film really helped to add some emotion and some fun.

All in all, this film was a very nice film that everyone should watch, People of all ages will love it.

review_title: Warning: A bloc of U.S. voters tanked this film's ratings
review_detailed_main:
This movie is warm, joyous, heroic, exciting, aesthetic and just plain fascinating. The cast is irresistible. Literally.

Bajrangi Bhaijaan is one of the best films I've ever seen, and I'm an old-timer who's seen around 4000, including most of the top-rated films of the last century. My wife and I fell in love with it. Our daughter saw it later and said it was the BEST movie she'd ever seen.

When we saw it at its first local release (with what seemed to be an all-Indian audience, apart from us), the movie had an IMDb rating of 8.5. Given that tastes differ, that's about what I would have predicted.

To my surprise, the overall ratings dropped to 8.2 after U.S. voters started weighing in. I was shocked (and frankly, ashamed) that we as a viewing public were apparently not equipped to appreciate such a brilliant work.

Today I went into the U.S. ratings and discovered (I think) what's been going on. The ratings from 2-10 show a usual sort of distribution, but OVER SIX HUNDRED VOTERS (more than half)rated it as a 1! Impossible! What that says to me is that some organized voting bloc deliberately tanked the U.S. ratings, probably for misguided religious, political or ethnic reasons. The result was that a pitifully small number of U.S. voters saw it at all.

That's why I'm posting my first IMDb review.

What that group did was a shameful act of vigilantism. If it isn't too late already, go see the movie for yourself. If you missed it on the big screen, catch it on Netflix. Unless your ideas are hopelessly fixed in some direction or another, you'll love it.

For a change, I was glad to see a Salman Khan movie having a sensible storyline. The topic has been handled with extreme sensitivity, so much so that I couldn't help myself from shedding a tear,during the climax. The movie is also powered by a couple of commendable performances. The first is by the young Harshaali Malhotra and the other by the awesome Nawazuddin Siddiqui's. The latter's introduction scene is hilarious.

Even Salman did a decent job, when compared to the rest of his films.

In my opinion, do give this movie is a bit over the top. But, it definitely deserves a watch. An ideal time pass. Go for it.

Rating: 6/10

Bajrangi Bhaijaan helm-ed by Kabir Khan takes you on a journey to Pakistan, without Visa albeit with plethora of emotions, exhilarating drama, high octane action, transcendent performances, mesmeric visuals, adroit craftsmanship making it a top notch motion picture. The last flick in which Salman Khan was directed by Kabir Khan namely "Ek Tha Tiger" turned out to be a blockbuster. So, when both these names decided to team up together for Bajrangi Bhaijaan, expectations were bound to be high. Generally, when you go to watch a movie with high expectations in mind there are chances of you getting disappointed but on the contrary Bajrangi Bhaijaan supersedes those apprehensions and engulfs you unto the movie right from its first frame. Is Bajrangi Bhaijaan at par/better than previous Salman starers? The answer is affirmative for the sole reason that this movie has its heart and soul at the right place. So numbed we are by the the onslaught of mindless southern remakes heavy with punchlines and raucous slapstick that an action film where the leading man (Salman Khan) doesn't loose his shirt automatically feels special. In this new film, Salman Khan is seen in a new emotional avatar who on his own travels to Pakistan to reunite a mute girl with her parents. Clearly this is a departure. As a standalone film, Bajrangi Bhaijaan is enthralling and most significantly an entertaining motion picture. On the exterior, it is a compelling sentimental story/thriller. But beneath the entertainment it offers, it carries a message as well. Loud and Clear. If the audience can see through the coating, great. Even if they don't, they will yet go back in high spirits. There are two conflicting factors in Bajrangi Bhaijaan ; Salman Khan's overriding principle of portraying silly antics on-screen and Kabir Khan's intrinsic liking for seriousness. But so overwhelming is Bhai's past aura that serious keeps threatening to slide into silly, and the moment you give in to that in-between space, the film becomes something that you enjoy to the core.Most of the time. Though, its a formulaic film yet it is not a typical Salman Khan kind of cinema. It ably brings the message of humanity, peace and human bonding to the forefront. How a person rigid about his religion can happily, peacefully co-exist with the unique ways of other religions. In fact, Salman's character is closest to #Being human (his charitable foundation) in this movie when compared to all other characters that he has portrayed in past. I could see a lot of moist eyes at the end of this movie which is proof enough that the movie tugs on the heartstrings of the audience.

review_title: Its a must watch...a landmark movie
review_detailed_main:
'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is a landmark film for it tries to bridge gaps between people of India and Pakistan without being preachy or moralistic. It is an extremely entertaining film but entertainment need not always be song-n-dance and popcorn- cola-jokes that don't last long.

Salman Khan delivered one of his finest performances in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Khamoshi'. After that film, 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is the film that taps the acting brilliance of Khan. Credit must go to Kabir Khan to have taken risks by not falling in the trap of what-the- distributors-want in a Salman Khan film. There are two brief action sequences, no item songs and a brief romance. In other words, Kabir completely breaks the formula that makes Salman such a safe blockbuster bet at the box office. Enough scope is given to Nawazuddin to display his magical brilliance and the kid Harshali Malhotra delivers a stunning performance (without delivering any dialogue). Om Puri shines in a cameo too. The presence of a strong support cast enhances Salman's performance greatly.

Somehow one can Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is a must watch film that will stay in your mind long after its over. The egotistical politicians on both sides of the border will keep on stoking the fire of hatred. If you want genuine people-to-people contact and a chance to let Love do the talking, then this film will hold hands of peace in front of you. It is up to you if you wish to put your hand forward and feel the warmth of brotherhood. Take a call.

review_title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan is a fun film that teaches lessons in humanity
review_detailed_main: Salman Khan plays Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', a clean hearted simpleton, a Hanuman bhakt with loyalty inherited from his father towards RSS. And he is refreshingly not the typical dude ready to throw punches in the air at any moment.He is the antithesis of a typical Salman Khan character; he is modest, peaceful and bows down even when he spots a monkey. Pawan meets Kareena Kapoor Khan when he comes to Delhi from UP to stay with his father's friend's family. The little girl in question, played by Harshaali Malhotra, is a scene-stealer from the very word go. She has an angelic face and expressive eyes, and good luck holding back your tears each time she sheds her own. Director Kabir Khan gives us some charming moments between Salman and her, starting with the bits when it dawns on him that she is neither brahmin nor kshatriya like he'd assumed. The film uses humor as a tool to address deep-set religious prejudices, like the one Pavan's landlord harbors against his meat-eating Muslim neighbors, or even Pavan's own discomfort about stepping into a masjid. There's also, conveniently, a romantic track with Kareena Kapoor, who, in only a few well-scripted moments reminds us just how good an actress she is, but who sadly seems content playing a largely decorative role.

review_title: 'Mama' has never sounded so beautiful before!
review_detailed_main:
Wow! Whatta film! Simple. Showing the life of commoners. Our beliefs. Our faith. Our ignorance.

Kareena has looked exceptionally pretty in ethnic Indian dresses. No Item Number – yea- Salman Bhaijaan took a great risk in releasing such a simple film without a speck of dirt! Siddiqui Rocks as a simple small time reporter! The film shows how simplicity has become un-expectable...and even unacceptable in our world today. Nobody is ready to believe the words of a simple, truthful man. Maximum people pass him off as a mad cap or a 'mental' case!

Also shows the 6th sense of children – of innocence.

Out of so many people, the 6 years old girl clings to Salman because she feels or connects with his simplicity in a jiffy!

The reporter proves that media is only interested in scandal and do not have the capacity to understand the importance of the really important things!

Film also shows our ignorance and how we divide ourselves either on the basis of religion or man-made borders.

Most amazing and shocking was the scene where the 6 years old girl reaches the sex-trade-market! Although with God's grace, she is saved instantly – but the fact that people sell and even buy such young children to sexually assault/ abuse & torture them is most shocking! How can such hotels/ brothels run in presence of police and administration is actually the question now!

Although in this film the pimps don't take revenge from Salman for interrupting their business....like they did in 'Tere Naam' – by hitting him continuously against the iron tube...and making him lose all his senses!

review_title: After a long time a really heart touching film... in history of world cinema
review_detailed_main:
Seriously I mean it. I think it is one of the best emotional film in world cinema. Most of the films deals with a boy and a girls love story, but Bajrangi Bhaijaan is not like that. Its also a love story but by true meaning of LOVE & HUMANITY. the child in the film fills your heart with love & cuteness.. And Nawaz is really awesome in the department of comedy. And finally the Salman Khan - what a performance,, claps claps.. Be it like a simple hanuman vakt or a emotional man ... He pulls it off. Its the best performance of Salman khan. Moreover its completely perfect teamwork. What a direction, kabir khan really deserves a standing ovation. And the cinematography of the film keeps u charged with awesomeness of Kashmir.

Its a great noble film that can be watch at any time in any mood.

For bunch of times. It's Salman Khan. Look what he has. A massive die-hard fans. A great family in business. A highest paid actor in business.

Now narrowing the view to the movie itself. Bajrangi Bhaijaan was destined to be released on Eid. It supposed to be fun (checked), meaningful (checked) and touching (checked). BB has it all. Winner takes it all.

To assess the movie, I'd like to divide it into some part, based on area that I know best.

First. Actor or casts. BB has great casts. First its own producer, Salman Khan. A contemporary leading actress, Kareena Kapoor Khan. A never-fail-us- again promising actor, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, and veteran actor like Om Puri. Well, it should be blockbuster, na?

Move aside to the story. Though it a bit irrelevant (in causal effect, of course) If Harshaali Malhotra (as Shahida or Munni) well- educated, it won't happen. And for Bajrangi devotee follower is no kidding. It implied that kid could see someone pure heart despite all the differences they had. I bet, as a kid, I won't even brave to follow some stranger with different religion. And BB brought it to the next level, two major clashes country, Indo-Pak. Since we know that BB has no focus on romance, we couldn't hope much, even Kareena in Gabbar is just a slight, not a good one. But in direction, it is just easy to follow. To sum up, the hero should be given to Nawazuddin instead Salman. But again, BB eagerly taught us that heart is an important thing than brain and desire.

Bajrangi kasam se, mujhe kehna tha sacch hai. I'm writing in a good form, and no regret to put it as 8. It just deserve that way, even some illogical event happened.

So that's it. sometime, you just be rewarded not because your bravery, simply because your pure heart. No kidding. We would live in that era rather than this. Who would do that in this era?

That remain questioned.

review_title: Don't miss this masterpiece at any cost
review_detailed_main: NO RELIGION,CASTE OR CREED IS BIGGER OR IMPORTANT THAN HUMANITY ITSELF,THAT"S WHAT THIS MOVIE IS ALL ABOUT". Finally after a long time,comes a director who did not uses SALMAN khan"s super stardom to just cash in money at the box office,kudos to kabir khan for using the actor SALMAN khan in it which the audience haven"t seen in a long time.Right from the first frame of the movie i got hooked to this beautiful journey of pawan and munni & enjoyed it thoroughly.Its the best commercial film that i have seen since 3 idiots. When it comes to character portrayal & building up characters,i really think Kabir Khan is no less than woody allen in any frame.Moving to the characters,the sole of the movie is definitely Salman and the little kid.Its the career best performance from Salman khan and he deserves all the respect and praise for this act.This movie will make u laugh and cry at the same time,especially the climax scene.Nawazzudin as chaand nawaab is terrific,but Harshaali steal the show all the way.Just surrender yourself to this movie and enjoy the sweet ride....and yes this time you did not need to leave your brain at home.Feel this movie and you will loved it to the core,SALMAN AT HIS BEST

review_title: An Awesome Family Entertainer. Go Watch it and not to be missed.
review_detailed_main:
This is my first review on IMDb, although I am a Movie Buff who watches Hollywood and Bollywood movies, i want to start reviewing with this Awesome effort at movie making which is called Bajrangi Bhaijaan.

The Movie is an all out family entertainer which will be enjoyed by the people of all ages. The Movie is high on emotion with story and a lot of good and honest performances from its lead and supporting casts.

Salman is in rocking form with this movie and gives an honest and brilliant performance which is quite different from his usual movies(comedy and lots of action), he shines throughout the movie and in all scenes.

The Other major character is played by the little cute girl Harshaali Malhotra, she is very good in her role and performs very well and lights up the screen each time she appears in a scene, everything from her expressions and acting.

Nawazudding Siddiqui is another actor who is cast perfectly in his role and his chemistry with Salman Khan is magical and each of their scene together is great to watch and Nawaz has a pivotal role in this movie. His comic timing is also great, he should do a comedy film too.

Kaeeena Kapoor is beautiful and as her previous films with Salman Khan shares great chemistry with him in this too.

All the supporting casts Om Puri, Sharad Saxena and others have done a good job.

Kabir Khan has a Gem of a movie this time and has done a great job behind the screen, his best till date, the amount of emotion this film has, he has handled it well.

The Cinematography is brilliant and has captured the beautiful locations in the movie the way it should be and the background score along with the music is great and has all the songs which you will enjoy especially the initial selfie song, to the Qawwali as with all the other songs. The action is good and is at the right places in the film.

Please note: I am giving a 10/10 review to this movie(instead of 8), as to average all the reviews, so that this Awesome Family movie is not missed by any one and watched by all because this movie should be considered on the lines of all Major Family Entertainers of Bollywood.

Go get entertained with this Entertainer.

review_title: Salman's best gift to the fans on the EID this year!

I watched this movie 2 times. It made my day as the best movie I have seen this year. Salman Khan again proves that he makes movies for family entertainment. This movie is surely an answer for those who use to say 'Salman Khan does not know acting'. This is a must watch for every film lover who likes to watch good movie, a family movie, a movie full of emotion, fun and a bit of action. The scene when Shahida(Harshaali) meets her mother and the last scene are full of emotions. I could see people crying in the movie hall in those scenes. Nawazuddin is superb with his journalist role.

There are scenes from Kashmir, Rajasthan that have been shot so beautifully that you would love to be there. This movie is such a masterpiece that you would not have expected from a Salman Khan movie.

Go for it!
Script is brilliant Story is brilliant Songs are brilliant Acting is brilliant An emotional journey with best message for humans.

review_title: Salman's best work since Tere Naam.
The Movie that Touch Billions of Pakistani and Indians

review_detailed_main:
When I heard Bajrangi Bhaijaan is releasing, I didn't even care to watch the trailer, just because of the fact that I have been expecting another normal Salman Khan film. But once this film hit the theaters and opened with rave reviews everywhere I decided to watch this movie.

After watching this movie, I was like WOW, That was unexpected, that too from a Salman Khan movie. This is movie with right blend of comedy, love, drama and whatsoever. This is a kinda movie that we have all been wishing from Bollywood. The incredible performance of Navazudheen Siddiqui is another highlight of the movie. Though we know Navaz as good actor from his earlier movies this movie puts him into spotlight.He

Even though, the movie is highly dramatic, we enjoy each and every moment in the movie. Salman did good in his role and this film never had a moment of unwanted heroism stuff, like we always see in his other movies. Kareena Kapoor doesn't have much role still she did good.

Harshaali Malhotra, the little girl, Shahida, is one of the cutest kids ever. Everyone would instantly fall in love with cute little girl. If the movie is a box office hit, it is a well deserved one.

This movie was released at a time when the tension between India and Pakistan began to rise again. We hear a lot about this tension in news and all everyday. I urge everyone, every Pakistani and Indian to watch this movie. It would surely help to strengthen the bond between us.

A nice movie from Kabir Khan and crew.

review_title: Din't live up to my expectations but still Great!
The Movie I've Been Waiting For
review_detailed_main:
Finally a Salman Khan movie with a good story. All of Salman's last 5-10 movies have been mediocre action flicks or not-so-good remakes of South Indian films. But this movie is awesome. Kabir Khan did an excellent job in directing and writer V. Vijayendra Prasad, also the writer of Baahubali, did a fine job.

The acting was great. Salman Khan did a solid job as Pawan and this was one of his best movies and performances, if not the best. Kareena Kapoor was good in the limited screen time she had. Nawawazuddin Siddiqui was great as Chand Nawab and also a bit comedic at times. And last but not least, Harshaali Malhotra was the highlight of this movie. She played a Pakistani girl who could not speak and was lost in India.

Overall this movie was amazing and shows man's determination and perseverance. There wasn't a dry eye in the theater at the end. Bajrangi Bhaijaan showed me that Salman Khan movies can still be at a high level. It didn't show Salman in too much action and fights, which was good. The only gripes I have with the film are that some scenes in the 1st half is a bit slow and occasionally boring as compared to the fast paced and entertaining 2nd half. Also, Kareena Kapoor is in the movie for about 30-40 minutes, so did she really have to be in the movie? Overall this movie is for anyone to watch and a great entertainer.

From A+ to F, Bajrangi Bhaijaan gets an A-.

What a movie... I am speechless... And I saw it without translation... No need for it, emotions say more then words... This is best movie I saw in past few years... Credits to actors and everyone who participated in making it...

I do not remember when is the last time I have seen a movie that has given me goose bumps very frequently but this one is undoubtedly one of them. First of all the story was excellent. Different types of events marvelously synchronized into one film. The acting of each and every single casts was outstanding no matter how big or small the role was. Specially Salman Khan and little Harshaali Malhotra was so good that their acting in this film can bring tears into your eyes and also make you laugh sometimes. This film also contains a good number of great songs. It can be said that this is one of the best movies of Salman Khan and a great starting for Harshaali Malhotra.The use of background music in different scene was outstanding as well. The ending of the movie was also very remarkable (some might say predictable but nonetheless remarkable).People who like to watch Bollywood movies I would suggest them to watch it because this particular movie totally worth your time and you will not regret watching it.

review_title: Another example of the excellence and diversity of Salman Khan's acting ability.
review_detailed_main: I Love Bajrangi Bhaijaan. I have never seen a more meaningful and thought-provoking film. Right from the start, I knew this was going to be a classic film, and my opinion was not changed throughout the course of the movie one bit. This is one of the finest movies ever made. Salman Khan is phenomenal in this film. Salman has given us many wonderful performances, but this one is his best!From its musical score, directing, special effects, location shooting, and the impressive acting ability of Salman Khan to keep one mesmerized by his solo performance, This movie is a WINNER! And I believe she should also win National Award for best child actor for this epic Bajrangi Bhaijaan.

review_title: A friend forced me to watch this movie.
A Heartfelt Tale Of Love & Innocence From Kabir Khan
review_detailed_main:
Make way for a whole new Salman - Here's Bajrangi Bhaijaan,the best Salman movie to come out in recent years, where we get to see 'Actor Salman' overshadow his over-the-top "Bhai" persona,showcasing the lovable character Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi A.K.A Bajrangi and his effort to unite a speech- impaired child who gets lost in India,with her family in Pakistan.

A light-hearted take on conquest of love and optimism over varied demarcations like religion and nationality,'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is a neatly packed entertainer that presents wholesome entertainment for all the sections of the audience ranging from the fans of Salman to the families.The film indirectly makes fun of various religious intolerances and differences,advocating the importance of brotherhood and love with an optimistic approach to the cross-border sentiments.

K.V.Vijayendra Prasad's story embarks viewers on a journey with its lead characters right from the word go making use of sensible natural humor,raining emotions and innocence of the lead characters,making it difficult to take the eyes of the screen until the climax is reached.Kabir Khan has succeeded in giving full justice to the well-written screenplay with his focused narration and excellence in handling sentimental sequences in particular.The climax even though satisfactory was tad over the top and on weak side comparing with the brilliance of the rest of the story.

Salman Khan & the little girl Harshaali Malhotra are a treat to watch on the screen and steals the show with their lovable performances.The innocence that both shower in their act is unmatchable and will make everyone fall in love with their characters in a flash.The transformation from an over-the-top hero to a ground-rooted man gives Salman the much needed break from his usual masala films where his characters looked repetitive on screen.Nawazuddin Siddiqui amazes yet again with his natural acting and ease in pulling out the character invested on him.The supporting cast too did their part well may it be Kareena Kapoor Khan or Mukhesh Khanna.

Soulful music by Pritam and Background Score by Julius Packiam does their job well complimenting the narration with the songs "Tu JoMila" and "Zindagi Kuch To Bata" being my personal favorites.Editing by Rameshwar S. Bhagat and editing by Aseem Mishra were good.

Overall,Bajrangi Bhaijaan is an engaging entertainer that blends innocence,emotions,humor,brotherhood and patriotism in right proportion.

Verdict::Minor loopholes in the screenplay & the lengthy narration keeps this from being called a perfect entertainer,but nevertheless 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is an engaging affair worth watching from the cinemas for its hearty storyline & genuine performances form Salman Khan and Harshaali Malhotra.Go for it!!

BAJARANGI BHAIJAAN is a must watch film. Different type of Salmaan Khan movie. But the movie completely manages to have intense grip on viewers. Story is superb and so is the cinematography. The locations chosen for the movie look very much apt with the storyline.

6 year old girl (called as Munni in the movie) has acted brilliantly. She definitely has won the hearts of viewers with her acting and that too without speaking any word. Nawazuddin Siddiqui as a Pakistani reporter has played a very important supporting role and yes he delivers it quite brilliantly. Nevertheless to mention, movie also shows how strong Internet is (YouTube videos) in terms of reaching out to the people.

The movie gives a very important message to the viewers that love and humanity have no borders. Hats off to Salmaan Khan for making viewers a part of such a wonderful and epic journey !!!

Bajrangi Bhaijan - Is probably one of the best films to come out from the Salman Khan stable coz of the fact that it's unlike any of the typical Bhai offering smile emoticon Salman is excellent in his 'aam-aadmi' portrayal in this 'plot-driven' movie which is devoid of the usual 'over-the-top' or 'irritating' sequences which we are used to being served in regular doses in his usual blockbuster avatars. The movie benefits greatly from the 'superb' performance from the lead child artiste and an 'absolutely brilliant' performance from the ever-reliable Nawazzudin Sidiqqui who is the real 'scene- stealer' in the second half . Though we do have sequences where cinematic liberties are aplenty and logic takes a bit of a backseat, Kabir Khan deserves due credit for his presentation style which rarely goes 'overboard' or 'preachy' in-spite of the sensitive subject he had chosen. Pritam's music is another 'top-notch' factor in this movie which is 'sincere', has its 'heart at the right place' and deserves it's minor flaws to be ignored :)

To start things off, Bajrangi Bhaijaan is about a mute girl who gets left in India. Luckily, there is a huge-hearted man to help her get home. Acting: All four actors are really good in their roles. Nawazuddin outdoes himself - again. As Chand the reporter, he is terrific as a slightly-comic supporting character. As well as the little girl, she is adorable! Kareena Kapoor has a minimum role but does well. But finally, the real star...... Salman Khan! He produced this, so he knew this character, which help him perform a brilliant performance. The best thing about Bajrangi Bhaijaan is that every scene makes you want to watch more, like in the cinema, at the interval. Another thing to point about is that the film has a bit of all ; comedy, romance, drama, action. The most touching scene in the whole two and a half film is the last five minutes of the climax. Beautiful! Thirdly, the movie is very original, there is no movie like it in the Twenty-first century. Fourthly, this is a movie Salman has never done. He normally does the same action movie again and again. But , the choice to do this movie was his best in his career. Finally, songs like Bhar Do Jholi and Tu Jo Mila stays with you for the rest of the WEEK! But the film stays with you for the rest of the MONTH!

Overall, all credit goes to Kabir Khan. Without him, the film would be AS good as it is. In basic words, let you and your family to watch this movie!

I normally don't vote 10/10 but given the topic and the effort put into this project, i have no choice but to rate it 10/10. I must admit, i have not enjoyed Indian cinema as of late, most titles are just trying too hard to provide viewers with entertainment, and they fail even at that. Salman Khan has proved once again, he is still capable of brilliant spot on acting. The chosen subject was a very delicate one. It is based on some harsh realities regarding IndoPak border and travel. It is truly unfortunate for the common folk who still have families and loved ones across these borders. One of the main reasons i voted this movie so high is cause of the cast. The little girl is so cute and sweet, you fall in love with her from the start right till the end. Even though she had no dialog in the movie, she did an unbelievable job of keeping you glued onto your seats for more of that cuteness. Costumes and sets were spot on, and did not feel misplaced for a moment. The director had a firm grip right till the end and knew his business. All in all this is a must have for any real fan of Indian cinema, and keeping in mind the senseless movies we have seen for the major part of the past decade, this one really is a gem. Thumbs up to Salman Khan and the whole Bhajrangi team.

review_title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan...a movie that you should never missed!!!

review_title: Salman Khan hit the right chord for once deviating away from his Larger than Life entertainers.
review_detailed_main:
When one goes to watch a Salman Khan movie in threaters, it is expected to be a pure entertainer with him being the Larger than life Hero. This one is quite opposite..

I wont write anything to reveal the story, but i am all praise of the brilliant work done by each and every character in the movie. Every character had a part and played it beautifully. The Dynamic Trio aka Nawaz, Salman and Harshalli were outstanding.

review_title: Unbelievable movie by Salman Khan!!!!! Super super hit
review_detailed_main: Mindblown by the incredible story line in Bajrangi Bhaijaan. Everyone must watch this awesome movie. Has everything a film could need, from action, to comedy, to romance and heartbreaking scenes of emotions. Hats off to Salman Khan and the adorable girl in this movie. Super work by director Kabir Khan and rest of cast. Very emotional and gut wrenching film.Make sure you bring napkins. Very powerful film indeed. Shows the humanity in humans. On the edge film and not a boring scene in the film. One of the best films by Salman Khan to date. Great work by Nawazuddin Siddiqui as well. Very well portrayed both sides of people on border very well. This movie will break records.

This is probably going to be the hardest thing for me to accept.. especially for a Salman Khan movie.. Watching him put his heart into acting.. Yes I said 'acting'.. I personally thought that Tere Naam was his best movie to date (one movie that I truly regret not watching at the cinema)..

As everyone does for every Salman movie, I left my brain at home expecting to cleanse my head of work stress.. But what I witnessed from frame one was entertainment with a lot of heart..

It's been a very long time since I've seen Salman portrayed as someone from planet earth.. Here's why; he takes punches, he wears normal clothes, he rides normal vehicles, he genuinely jokes, he emotes and, he talks like a normal person. Above all, he genuinely acted! Kabir Khan deserves a standing ovation for this achievement.

Nawazuddin, Kareena and Om Puri did their roles brilliantly.. But the real hero's were Harshaali and her mom (don't know her name and for some strange reason not listed any where).. Harshaali's mom did a brilliant job in every scene she had appeared. Although not a word spoken by Harshaali, her emotions were enough to keep the audience engaged for 2.45 hours.

Overall, this movie is a must watch and I would say brilliant in every aspect (can't believe I said that for a Salman movie).. and above all, my dad kept awake all throughout the movie! :p

Overall rating: 10/10

review_title: Super! Awesome! Fun film! Except the last 10-12 minutes!
review_detailed_main:
'BAJRANGI BHAIJAAN'

Super! Awesome! Fun film! Except the last 10-12 minutes!

Obviously an effort by the filmmaker to bring the two warring nations of Pakistan and India closer, the film had almost an utopian setting where the pakistani border rangers, pakistani maulana, pakistani people and pakistani journalists are all nice, decent, loving people! (How I wish this was true!)

An implausible story made with so much conviction. love and heart that the audience wants to take it as it is served! I took it too and thoroughly enjoyed it!

Performances by 'He-never-left-but-he-is-back-again' Salman Khan are totally-deliciously lovely and demands audience's belief! 'Munni' played by the most-cute-lovely Harshaali Malhotra is just super-cute-huggable- kissable-adorable character ever! I hope she grows up to a great actor and doesn't waste her life-career!

Nawazuddin Siddiqui played 'Chand Nawab', a pakistani aspiring journalist who eventually becomes the 'catalyst' for the success of the story and its characters' motives, is just simply, awesomely, super-awesomely brilliant!

Nawaz does NOT know how to act! He doesn't need to! He just becomes the character! I would here on this day dated July 28th, 2015 announce that I think he is the greatest Indian actor ever!

I think Amitab Bachan sahab, Dilip Kumar Sahab and my favourite Late Dev Anand sahab are the gods of acting! But I would rate Nawaz sahab higher them all! For the latter just doesn't act! He just becomes the character! His "acting" is simply flawless! I hope I get to work with him some day!

The gorgeous Kareena Kapoor didn't have much to do but what ever her character was, she did total justice to it! And she looked super-gorgeous! We all know she is a great actor but here she didn't have much to do! (BTW I love her in 'Omkara'. The cinematography by Mr. Aseem Mishra is just perfect! Perfect! Perfect! I don't think there is anything I can say which isn't obvious!

The film is crisply cut and there is no lag of any sorts!

The music of the film was however a big letdown! None of the songs except 'Zindagi' are memorable or has any repeat value! Super disappointed! About the direction by Kabir Khan is majorly brilliant! I have been his fan since 'kabul Express' and I have always liked his sensibilities! The same sensibilities were evidently visible here in 'BB' again. Except the climax which I feel is forced, way over-the-top melodramatic and to be honest, highly-implausible and bit cringe-worthy! But I guess he did it to serve the masses who probably all loved it!

I too can appreciate the thought and the economics behind it but the logical chap inside me just won't understand it!

Long story short- 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' is a great, fun, family film which everyone should watch! The performances are awesome! The story is soft and gooey and delicious! The visuals are stunning, fresh and crisp! The film has a bit of 'epic' feel at times but mainly hovers over the main character 'Pavan Kumar Chaturvedi' who is just adorable, and the lovely 'Munni' is far-far more memorable and adorable then the other previous 'Munni"!

My rating: 7.5/10 (2.5 deducted for below average music and the last 10 minutes!)

review_title: Salman Khan's best film in the last 2-3 years!
review_detailed_main: Kabir Khan, who's last film was Ek Tha Tiger with Salman Khan, was a huge disappointment according to me. I loved Kabul Express and New York. So because of those two, I went to watch Bajrangi Bhaijaan. This is the best film of Salman Khan in past 2-3 years which contains heart-touching storyline, good performances and great locations. A dumb girl of Pakistan (Harshali) missed her train from Atari to Lahore, and reached Kurukshetra where Pavan Kumar (Salman Khan) met her. He then helped her to find out her native. When he came to know that the girl was from Pakistan, then he tried his best, but, couldn't do anything. So, he himself took an oath to take that girl from India to Pakistan. Will he get success, that answer you will find out after watching the movie. Salman Khan has delivered a mature performance. Not a single frame is here where you can tell that he's doing over-acting. Kareena looks so beautiful in her tiny role. Nawazbhai is again giving a tough fight to Salman Khan. He is too good in his role, doing comedy as well as emotional scenes. Om Puri is also there in a cameo. Others are also good. But, the main hero or you can say heroine of BB is Harshali. She is damn cute. No one can control his or her emotions in the last scenes. She deserves a big round of applause. Music by Pritam is good. I don't know why Tu Chahiye and Chiken song have been put in he film. No need of them. Selfie Le Le Re song is good for Salman Khan fans as they have to shout on his entry. Bhar Do Jholi is my the most favorite from this album, sung by Adnan Sami & penned by Kausar Munir. But, the perfect suitable song of BB is Tu Jo Mila. This song is able to make tears in your eyes. Dialogues are good. Especially of Nawazuddin, they are witty and enjoyable. One plus point of the movie is that unnecessary fighting was prohibited. Cinematography is awesome. Kashmir looks like a heaven. Kabir Khan has made a heart-touchy beautiful movie, which can able to make the audience laugh as well as cry in the end. Apart from that two unnecessary songs, nothing is going to stand in the minus point's list. So, Kabir Khan has made a very good movie with Salman Khan that everyone has to watch. Bahubali is so strong movie, standing along with BB. But, I'm saying BB is better than Bhaubali for sure. Those, who are confuse between Bahubali & Bajrangi, just go for Bajrangi Bhaijaan. After watching this, you will fell so proud that you witnessed this in the theater. Meanwhile, the collection is crossed the 100cr mark!
Waste of money, time and effort. I'd watch Baahubali 1 and 2 rather than this boring movie.

review_title: It proves why people admire salman khan...... It is the best of salman till date
review_detailed_main: Superb in all aspects. It narrates a beautiful human story which casts some superstars with their mind-blowing performance. In the 160 mins movie you will not be bored for a while. Salman khan plays a different character with full of bhakti and innocence unlike his past movies,harshali aka munni is as cute as an angel. The two drives the film to win heart of the people with their chemistry. Nawazuddin has short though powerful as well as most important role in that film. He acts so naturally that even salman khan's magic fades beside him. Kabir khan uses kareena to support salman in the first half and her beauty at this age is still astonishing. Kabir has directed the film so beautifully end wrapped the story with scenic beauty so well that tear is sure to come at the last 20 minutes. Above all it is a gem of salman's life and film industry..... Don't even dare to miss it.

Respect for all the characters in the movie. A very well thought of story line with a lot of substance & emotions. After a long time I would say this movie is a comeback for the whole industry itself.

An inspiration in itself. Heart-touching. Beautiful. I am out of words. One of the very best Bollywood movies till date. A Must watch. A complete refresher.

Lastly, would also like to mention. Bajrangi Bhaijaan. Bajrangi Bhaijaan. Bajrangi Bhaijaan.!!!

review_title: Man salman is amazing in this role

The Plot, Acting by Salman, Nawaz, Little but Cute Girl,Will Surely give you a touch of excellence..About Direction its done brilliantly...All Songs are Awesome..Mostly Haters of Salman Khan are putting their all efforts to under-rate this movie but if you really want to witness a emotional but joyful ride then go and watch this Movie...

Almost one year ago salman khan announced that he is again collaborating with his "ek tha tiger" movie director kabir khan. The project , "With a cross border theme" was titled bajrangi bhaijaan. Media started framing all sorts of nonsense stories of love jihad and blah.. blah.. I almost hated the title, even the teaser and the selfie song. Watching movie on eid day is like a ritual among my siblings. After few scary thoughts i went to the theater and....... The rest is history.

The last movie which i enjoyed so much was 3 idiots.unlike other salman khan movies where there is little scope of story and has only dialog's, macho-ism.this one has a beautiful story and vice versa. Salman has done utmost justice to his role of a hanuman devotee. The little girl is undoubtedly the "find of the year". With only gestures and emotions she has outperformed many a-list actresses. Nawazuddin in the role of news reporter was class apart. Surprisingly his entry scene got more claps and whistles than salman's. All the supporting cast have done their part efficiently. Kabir khan's direction is excellent. Songs are treat to both eyes and ears. No shame in admitting that i cried during the climax.. best movie of 2015. highly recommended.

review_title: It's not a film, but a campaign to bind the hearts of two nations
review_detailed_main:
I went to watch Bajrangi Bhaijaan with a "Salman Khan Hater". And during the movie I saw many times tears rolling out of her eyes.

I think the above incident says it all.

Everyone knows the issues between India and Pakistan. Everyone feels the heat. But this film tries to show that the common people of both the countries don't hate each other; they have love.. have emotions.

Some people may praise Salman for the film, some may say it's Kabir Khan's magic, few will tell Harshali is the best part of the film and rest may credit Vijayendra. But at the end of the day all will agree that the film is a Masterpiece.

review_title: The Mature & Human Salman we all knew....
review_detailed_main:
#BajrangiBhaijaan is Salman Khan's 2nd venture with Kabir Khan and the bond between the two has grown manifold. This is the first Salman movie in the 21st century where another actor has overpowered/overshadowed him, no its not d talented Nawazuddin Siddiqui or the Gorgeous Kareena Kapoor Khan, its the cute 6 yr old Harshali Malhotra. She's the Main Lead who despite being mute in the movie takes all the applauds for her amazing expressive acting, way to go kid......

Its a tight slap on the face of a select few critics who are miser in rating Salman Khan movies. Remember he would not have lasted so long if he could not act! He can act, re. Maine Kyar Kiya, Khamoshi, Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam, Tere Naam, Kyunki and Dabangg to name a few.

All artists have to re evolve themselves to withstand change, so has Salman, the choice of his movies these days reflect on him maturing personally. Entertainment with a Social Message is what he's focusing right now. Jai Ho had mixed acceptance, Kick received loads of love and now Bajrangi Bhaijaan has taken it to roof smashing heights.

review_title: Salman Khan's Best Movie Till Date
review_detailed_main:
Before watching the Bajrangi Bhaijaan, I thought it is a typical Anti-Pakistan movie like Bollywood does make. Salman would enter Pakistan and fight with the whole Nation for just a single girl. But after watching the movie my Point of view has been completely changed by the idea of friendship between the two Rival and Neighbor Countries. The only scene i did not like from the movie was the fight of Bajrangi Bhaijaan with Pakistan Police. I thought of giving it a 9/10 Rating but after watching the whole movie I could not stop myself from giving it a 10/10 marks. The movie is a mixture of very emotional scenes and comedy scenes. The Brilliant acting by Salman Khan and Nawazuddin Siddiqui could make it a BlockBuster but the Emotions of the Little "Munni" made it a historical movie of Bollywood. I have no doubt in Saying that it is the Best move of the veteran actor Salman Khan. Even the Mr. Perfectionist Aamir Khan said that it is the movie which can defeat PK.

The Film contains so many scenes which can make you its fan. For example, when Munni celebrated the win of Pakistan in front of a patriotic family like a boss. When Munni went into Masjid instead of going to Mandir. The way Salman entered the Madrassah and left it. The way Pakistan Army gave Permission to Salman Khan to enter the country.

The movie is also historic as we get our very own "Prem" back at least for one movie. The cuteness of Salman Khan is having a very big role in the movie. The way he speaks Truth every where and even in Pakistan, continues to tell people that he is from India and has crossed the border Illegally by crawling through the wires and that he is the "Bajrang Bali Bhagat", has mesmerized the audience completely.

The Film is completely perfect and a must watch movie for all Pakistanis and Indians. It is also worth mentioning that it is complete family movie and you can absolutely watch it even with your parents. The Film is Perfect. The acting, expressions, emotions, comedy, action, story, music, songs, dialogues, locations, i.e. everything is perfect. I would highly recommend everyone to watch the movie with full family and enjoy as it is literally a "One in a Million" movie

review_title: Wins your heart in straight sets !!!
review_detailed_main: A heart warming movie which I am lucky to watch after 6 months of long gap at satyam Cineplex at Nehru place, New Delhi, whatever reason of the delay may be. But then change is the only constant in life! Pawan Kumar Chaturvedi's simple, religious but stubborn and emotional character is depicted by Salman with ease, this movie will surely increase his fan followers many folds. Nawazuddin has taken himself to a different genre all together by now, he as the supportive and sensitive Pakistani reporter is simply awesome. But no words can explain the performance of the gifted child actress Harshali who has played the character of the mute and deaf girl from Pakistan lost in India. We have laughed with her, cried with her. The beauty of Kashmir and colour of Delhi have given another dimension to this movie by Kabir Khan. Karina also looks stunning, but unfortunately like any other Salman movie, actress here also has very little role to play. It also doesn't portray Pakistan as a completely evil nation, which is a good thing. The music by Pritam is descent even if not extraordinary. The best thing is you will never get bored during the entire length of the movie. However yes, there are few stereotype and melodramatic scenes - like Salman wants to cross the border without visa but with permission from Pakistani soldiers or the last scene, but when something wins your heart in straight sets you can overlook few unforced errors! 8/10 from me.

Great entertainment Like all rom-coms, Bajrangi Bhaijaan parkles with romance, merriment and heartache, is brightly glossy and boasts of crackling chemistry between its lead actors, but Ayan makes sure the heady concoction never waters down. The best part is, he never borrows from romantic clichés that most love stories depend upon and that, in my opinion, is this film's biggest strength. Expect no unwanted melodrama, no unwelcome characters, no earsplitting background music to accentuate the proceedings... On the whole,This is a revitalizing take on romance and relationships. The movie had its limitations such as over extension of the story towards the end of second half, despite it maintained a decent pace. Many scenes were over-engineered but the sentiments were always preserved in a correct way. It showed a good angle of Indo Pak love relationship without any foolish sentiments.

Everyone delivered an average acting performance with Salman and Nawazuddin slightly above the rest. There were few good Pakistani scenes involving Nawaz in which he nailed most of it. Neither Salman showed his standard stupidity nor the movie tried to structure like that.

Quite experienced with Hindu-Muslim and Indo-Pak relationships, Kabir Khan made a good use of it. Direction was consistently good and effort was noticeable. He made sure movie doesn't loose its plot and becomes lovable.

Music was avoidable and anyways made no impact either ways.

Overall, movie with good sentiments that never looses its plot.

"Bajrangi Bhaijaan" is a cinematic masterpiece that transcends borders, directed by Kabir Khan. Starring Salman Khan as Pavan, a devout Hanuman devotee with a heart as vast as his beloved deity, the film unfolds a heartwarming journey of compassion, humanity, and self-discovery.

The story follows Pavan as he discovers and befriends Munni, a mute Pakistani girl separated from her family during a trip to India. Determined to reunite Munni with her parents across the border, Pavan embarks on a cross-country odyssey, facing numerous challenges that test his resilience and unwavering spirit.

Salman Khan delivers a career-defining performance, portraying Pavan with a perfect blend of innocence and strength. Harshaali Malhotra, who plays Munni, steals hearts with her expressive eyes and endearing presence. The on-screen chemistry between the two leads forms the emotional core of the film.

The film's narrative is complemented by breathtaking cinematography, capturing the diverse landscapes of India and the emotional nuances of the characters. The music, composed by Pritam, adds a soulful layer to the storytelling, with the anthemic "Selfie Le Le Re" and the soul-stirring "Bhar Do Jholi Meri" becoming instant classics.

What makes "Bajrangi Bhaijaan" exceptional is its underlying message of unity and love, transcending political boundaries and cultural differences. The film tugs at the heartstrings, evoking laughter and tears in equal measure. Kabir Khan masterfully balances the emotional depth with moments of humor, making it a wholesome cinematic experience.

The supporting cast, including Nawazuddin Siddiqui as the quirky travel companion Chand Nawab, adds depth to the narrative. The film also benefits from its tight screenplay, ensuring that every scene contributes to the overall emotional impact.

In conclusion, "Bajrangi Bhaijaan" is a rare gem in Indian cinema, a heartwarming tale that resonates globally. Salman Khan's stellar performance, coupled with Kabir Khan's directorial finesse, makes it a must-watch for those seeking a story that transcends borders and celebrates the universal language of compassion. With its five-star rating, "Bajrangi Bhaijaan" stands as a testament to the power of storytelling and the enduring spirit of humanity.

Mr Salman Khan's character takes on a nations army Wins over the hearts of its people with his commitment , dedication and love . The areas of highlights are Histrionics ! Mr Khan enthrals us with his performance as an actor . Somehow , he reminds us of another great actor Mr Sanjeev Kumar . The character is multi faceted Innocent , naive , strong yet stupid , loving but has his bigotry , committed but has flaws in his nature, simple but strong willed , sticks to his own rules but doesn't bend or break them , can fight but chooses not to fight !!! We can go on and do an In depth analysis of this complex character who appears simple , that's just due to mastery of the portrayal of this role ! Everybody seems to be going gaga over the other two main characters in this film , they fail to notice the understated yet powerful performance of Mr Khan. People need to stop bringing in and highlighting the personal lives of the star of this film . Instead if they focused on the performance they will realise that here is one guy who can do it all and do it all with his own trademark style. The Director should get a particular mention here as he knew what he was doing and at no point he let the audience down at the same time gave us what he wanted to serve rather than what we expected , true hall marks of a visionary story teller. Mr Kabir Khan thanks a million for this wonderful journey which people call as a film ! You've done justice to the lead character and to the supporting roles without undermining any of their presence. The film world will look back in time and wonder at this Marvellous jewel called Bajrangi Bhaijaan. It's a true landmark in history of movie making. I wish you more and more success . And Mr Salman Khan , we wish that you could provide us more than an occasional glimpse of your true acting talent . You've proved that you are on par or even better than your two fellow compatriots ( Khans as well ) Thanks again for entertaining us . Wishing you and praying for even greater success in future Eid Mubarak Bhai.
